question:
In light of October 16th being observed as World Food Day, consider the following statements about the yet to be implemented Red Labelling proposed by FSSAI:
  1. The red label is to be used on the food package if it contains high salt content.
  2. FSSAI has called for labelling in case of use of genetically modified ingredients in the packaged food.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The red label was proposed as a part of the Food Safety and Standards (Labelling and Display) Regulations, 2018 draft. The label was to be used on the front of the packaging in case of high fat, sugar and salt content in the food. The FSSAI is also contemplating use of color coding for other less healthy food materials. Statement 2 is correct: In a first, the draft regulation by FSSAI also recommended labelling of food items containing genetically modified ingredient. It set the threshold at 5% for labelling. India is yet to start cultivating genetically modified food crops. However, genetically modified cotton is already under cultivation.
